alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Kemper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 11:08AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Jasper, southeastern Newton, southern Kemper, northwestern Clarke and Lauderdale Counties through NOON CST... At 1107 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Herbert Springs to Roberts. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Liberty, Damascus, Prismatic and Martin around 1115 AM CST. Blackwater and Daleville around 1120 AM CST. Meehan and Porterville around 1130 AM CST. Meridian, Nellieburg, Electric Mills and Suqualena around 1135 AM CST. Marion around 1145 AM CST. Meridian Station around 1150 AM CST. Lauderdale and Tamola around 1155 AM CST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for east central Mississippi.
